page.title: 10FORMS OF TRANSPORT
page.content: We wanted to find out how many forms of transport each family owned. In our survey we asked 24 children. Of the 24 families only one did not have a car, 18 families had one car, 4 had two and 1 family had three cars. Perhaps the most surprising fact we discovered was that related to bicycles. Every family had at least one bike, 7 families had two, 7 had three, 6 had four bikes and 3 families had five. We found that the number of bicycles each family had was relative to the number of children in that family. Another discovery was that 10 families in our survey owned a boat, we did not expect this to be so high, perhaps it is because we live near to a canal. Motorbike and scooter owners were lower than we had expected.
